location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: ‘PLAN OF THE ENTRANCE TO AL ANJMAN & ZORA KHORS Surveyed by Lieutenant G. L. Hodson & Sub-Lieut. Champness JUNE 1911 H.M.S. Fox’

physicalDescription.extent: Materials: printed on paper. Dimensions: 380 x 460mm, on sheet 420 x 480mm.

mods.abstract: This coastal chart shows the bar and entrance to Zora Khor, indicating hydrology, topography and soundings in feet. On the left of the chart are a triangulation diagram and a short note on survey methodology. The chart also bears the printing statement 'Simla Drawing Office Topo. Dy. No. 117 Exd. C.J.A. August 1911'. The chart was attached to a report (folio 12) on Zora Khor by the Senior Naval Officer in the Persian Gulf, who concluded that it would not make a suitable harbour for the coastal shipping trade, despite British plans to establish a wireless telegraph station at Zora.
